snippet: With help from high-priced advisers, President Bashar al-Assad and his wife tried to portray themselves as progressive, and even glamorous, in the Western news media.
abstract: Syria's Pres Bashar al-Assad and his family have sought to portray themselves in the Western media as accessible, progressive and even glamorous; hired high-priced Western public relations advisers to burnish their image in magazines and online outlets; in March 2011, just as security forces initiated a brutal crackdown on political opponents, Vogue magazine ran a flattering profile of Syria's British-born first lady Asma.

byline.original: By BILL CARTER and AMY CHOZICK

lead_paragraph: With help from high-priced advisers, President Bashar al-Assad and his wife tried to portray themselves as progressive, and even glamorous, in the Western news media.
